decks.notes: This deck focuses on using powerful disruptive cards like Blood Moon, Trinisphere, and Chalice of the Void to slow down opponents while quickly applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Hazoret the Fervent. The goal is to lock opponents out of casting spells with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and overwhelm them with a combination of efficient creatures and high-impact spells like Fiery Confluence. By utilizing a combination of mana acceleration and powerful disruptive elements, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm opponents before they can recover.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with countermagic and removal spells. By utilizing powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Delver of Secrets alongside disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while beating them down quickly. The inclusion of cards like Deathrite Shaman and Lightning Bolt adds versatility and consistency to the deck's game plan, allowing it to adapt to different matchups and strategies.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting their game plan with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also utilizes powerful cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for more threats and answers. With a mana base consisting of dual lands and Wastelands to disrupt opponent's mana base, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game until victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Aluren combo as the win condition. The deck uses a combination of efficient creatures, card draw spells, and disruption to control the game until it can assemble the Aluren combo. This combo allows the player to cast creatures with a converted mana cost of 3 or less for free, enabling the deck to generate a lot of value and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes removal and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, allowing for explosive combos to be executed. This is achieved through cards like Faithless Looting, Cabal Therapy, and Breakthrough to quickly mill through the deck and trigger abilities of cards like Narcomoeba and Bridge from Below. The inclusion of Street Wraith, Stinkweed Imp, and Golgari Grave-Troll provide additional dredge options to keep the engine running. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of creatures and tokens generated from the graveyard.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, then combo off with cards like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony to deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe to help find combo pieces and protect the combo. Infernal Tutor is used to search for specific cards, while cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy disrupt the opponent's strategy. This deck aims to win the game through a powerful storm mechanic.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana through rituals and artifacts like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, while digging through the deck with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The ultimate goal is to cast a storm spell like Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting its own combo. The key strategy is to efficiently combo off and win the game before the opponent has a chance to react.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly with cards like Lotus Petal, Lion's Eye Diamond, and rituals, while also drawing and filtering through the deck with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe. The goal is to assemble the pieces needed to cast Ad Nauseam and draw a large portion of the deck, followed by playing Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent with a storm count that has been built up throughout the game. The inclusion of disruption like Duress and Cabal Therapy helps to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to rapidly build up mana through cards like Dark Ritual and Rite of Flame, and then cast a large number of spells in a single turn to generate a storm count and finish off the opponent with cards like Empty the Warrens or Tendrils of Agony. The deck also utilizes cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to search for specific combo pieces or answers to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, aiming to win the game in a single turn.

This control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent while generating card advantage and value through powerful spells like Punishing Fire, Force of Will, and Snapcaster Mage. It utilizes a mix of removal, counterspells, and card draw to control the game and protect its threats like Baleful Strix and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck can grind out wins through attrition with cards like Grove of the Burnwillows and Deathrite Shaman, while also having powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Chandra, Torch of Defiance for additional control and card advantage.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt opponent's strategies through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal, while also generating value with cards like Young Pyromancer and Gurmag Angler. The deck aims to control the game's tempo by efficiently answering threats and setting up its own win conditions through card advantage and board presence. The mix of permission spells, cantrips, and versatile removal options allows the deck to adapt to various matchups and playstyles, making it a versatile and powerful control archetype in the Legacy format.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token quickly, while disrupting opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. It includes acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide to quickly execute the combo, along with protection in the form of Sylvan Safekeeper. The deck utilizes land tutors like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying to find the pieces needed to execute the combo, making it a fast and powerful strategy in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is using efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis, Snapcaster Mage, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, Baleful Strix, and Deathrite Shaman alongside disruptive spells like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Hymn to Tourach to maintain board control while applying pressure on the opponent. The deck also has removal spells like Fatal Push, Abrupt Decay, and Diabolic Edict to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck includes card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Brainstorm to ensure a steady stream of resources.

This UWx Control deck is focused on utilizing a variety of counter spells, removal, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game. By effectively managing opponent's threats with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, and manipulating the top of the library with Counterbalance and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to out value and out control opponents to secure victory. Additionally, cards like Back to Basics and Supreme Verdict provide additional tools to shut down opponent's strategies and clear the board when necessary.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while gradually building up a board presence through value creatures and removal spells. It aims to control the game tempo by using cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's plays, while also utilizing powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to pressure the opponent. The deck also has a strong mana denial plan with cards like Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman, allowing it to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and out-tempo the opponent to secure victory.

This Grixis Control deck revolves around using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption to control the game and outvalue opponents. The deck utilizes cards like Punishing Fire, Kolaghan's Command, and Cabal Therapy to dismantle opposing strategies while generating value with Young Pyromancer and Deathrite Shaman. Card advantage is gained through Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe, with finishers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor providing a win condition. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining board presence and card advantage to secure victory.
